dji.sdk.api.Camera

Class DJICameraSDCardInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.Camera.DJICameraSDCardInfo

  • public class DJICameraSDCardInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    Camera SD card Information Class

    By using this class, the current SD card status could be immediately transported. Developer could use hasError to detect whether the SD card has error or not. For some protection, SD card will be set up as read only. To avoid mistake occurs, the readOnly attribute could be used to confirm the status. Other status of the SD card could be found out in this data structure, too. For example, invalidFormat is for detecting the format is invalid or not. The isFormat and isFormating are for checking the status of SD card formation.
    Importantly, please checkout whether the SD card is inserted into camera before taking photo or recording video. The boolean attribute isInserted is used to detect the status of SD card inserting status.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean hasError
      Whether or not the SD card has an error.
      boolean invalidFormat
      Whether or not the SD card has an invalid format.
      boolean isFormated
      Whether or not the SD card is formated.
      boolean isFormating
      Whether or not the SD card is formating.
      boolean isFull
      Whether or not the SD card is full.
      boolean isInserted
      Whether or not the SD card is currently inserted into the camera.
      boolean isValid
      Whether or not the SD card is valid.
      boolean readOnly
      Whether or not the SD card is read-only.
      int remainCaptureCount
      Returns the number of pictures that can be taken with the remaining space availabe on the SD card.
      int remainSize
      Returns the remaining space in bytes available on the SD card.
      int totalSize
      Returns the total space in bytes available on the SD card.

        public boolean isValid
        Whether or not the SD card is valid. The SD card will not be valid if it is fake, which can be a problem if the SD card was purchased by a non-reputable retailer.
